page.title: 11AIREDALE SCOUTS AND CUBS
page.content: The 5th Airedale Scout Group meets every Monday night,Cubs 6.30,Scouts8.0.The evenings activities are based on ceremony,badge work and games.During the Opening ceremony, "Grand Howl"cubs reaffirm their promise and the Union Flag is broken.Games include football and relay races which tend to be rather noisy but full of fun. Badge work covers everything that cubs and scouts learn from sewing on buttons to camp-fire cooking,this being based on the founder Baden Powell's ideas of survival in the great outdoors. Weather permitting summer evenings are spent out of doors working on tracking,cooking,sports etc. In April each year a St. George's Day Parade is held when Scout groups meet to remember the World Wide Movement.
